column4: hmm, I can't quite figure this out; I have a line that works in the terminal, but when I try to create a launcher with that command, it doesn't do anything
what is the line?
/usr/bin/vncviewer -passwd ~/.vnc/passwd 192.168.2.20:0.0
:: that doesn't really matter though, it works in the terminal fine
what all is it supposed to do for you
:: it's supposed to open the vncviewer program to that IP address, with the password in the file
should it initialize a vncviewer window?
:: yeh, basically
ok, when you go to make the launcher, the first option says "Type: Application"
simply change that to "Application in Terminal"
:: I tried that, it opens the terminal and closes it immediately
I don't understand it fully, but some applications require a terminal to run
:: regardless, it doesn't run either way
so the vncviewer isn't working even when run from a terminal?
:: it works when I run it from a terminal, yes, but it doesn't work at all when run from the launcher, terminal or no
in my own vnc setup I simply bypass the need for the vncviewer, if you are using tightvncserver, it has a built in java interface that can be accessed over http
:: I seem to have the same problems with xtightvncviewer
I don't know what else to do
have you tried using Applications > Internet > Terminal Servers Client
that is vncviewer with a graphical config I think

when I made a launcher for vncviewer to connect to my server, it worked correctly when set as "application in terminal", the only difference is that I included the host in the command and it asked for the password rather than having that done by  passwd
